data.title: GraphicsDevice RenderTarget Fixes
PSM solution doesn't compile
data.body:
The PSM solution/projects currently don't compile due to some very odd code. Not sure if someone did a partial commit, or just didn't try compiling before committing. Either way, the attached patch fixes compilation.

I was editing in VS2012+ReSharper and compiling in PSM Studio 1.10. I cleaned up a number of ReSharper warnings/hints along the way. If the patch is accepted, there are other cleanups I can do.

I haven't been able to successfully test it because all samples rely on .xnb files, which are not present and no pre-build steps produce them.

https://gist.github.com/matthargett/5418124

data.title: MGCB Support For Content Projects
data.body:
This PR adds support for using the MonoGame content builder tools with an existing XNA .contentproj without any need for XNA Game Studio to be installed on the system.
- Added fix to MGCB.exe avoid exception when content listing file doesn't exist.
- Added /quiet switch to MGCB.exe.
- Added new .targets file which replaces the `Microsoft.Xna.GameStudio.ContentPipeline.targets` import.

The usage is fairly simple:
1. If you are using custom content processors rebuild them against MonoGame.
2. Replace the <Import> of `Microsoft.Xna.GameStudio.ContentPipeline.targets` with `MonoGame.Content.Pipeline.targets`.
3. Place MGCB.exe and its dependent assemblies into the `$(MSBuildExtensionsPath)\MonoGame\v3.0\` folder.
4. Build.

Please give it a test and report back any issues.

data.title: Fix for Windows Phone 8 template.
data.body: Added MediaElement to the WP8 template so now it works.

data.title: Full support for DXT/S3TC textures
data.body: Based on reported extensions for OpenGL, DXT mipmapped textures are now supported by all devices that claim support for the formats.

data.title: Added handling of exceptions when the OpenAL hardware driver fails
data.body: Added handling of exceptions when the OpenAL hardware driver is initialized and then to throw the NoAudioHardwareException when openAL is used without proper initialization. Also implemented the missing ctors in NoAudioHardwareException.cs.

data.title: Effect Memory Optimizations
data.body:
This PR makes changes to how Effects are created to reduce their memory usage at runtime.

The most useful fix was replacement of our uses of List<> with fixed sized arrays.  We had lots of places where the List<> had one element in it...  but under the hood List<> allocates in chunks.  So you would have this totally unused memory floating around in largely empty lists.

Second I switched to explicit Clone() methods for the collections instead of constructors.  This allows for example to EffectAnnotationCollection.Clone() to return a shared "empty" collection instead of allocating a new one.  This also saved alot of memory as we have a lot of empty collections in Effects.

My test was allocating 10,000 BasicEffect objects and measuring the system memory using the GC methods.

Before: 87MB
After: 61MB

So overall a 29% reduction in memory usage.  

Still each BasicEffect eats up 6K of memory each... which is sort of fat IMO.

My goal moving forward is to reduce this even greater, but this will take some deeper changes to how EffectParameter and EffectPass work.

data.title: Support For Signed Numbers in MGFX
data.body:
This adds support for signed numbers in both render states and sampler states in an MGFX file.

It is a fix for #1653.

data.title: OpenAL - DllnotFound is fatal
data.body:
If openal is not installed or not accessible, then the cal to Alc.OpenDevice in OpenALSoundController (WindowsGL project for testing) will throw DllNotFoundException, which is not handled.

This should have been handled when the OpenALSoundController was ractored to handle openAL open failures.

data.body:
I have the following shader: https://gist.github.com/timotei/db0bb1dc743b26e2717c

On line 37, I've set a negative value for the MipLODBias parameter. However, when compiling it with MGFX, I get the following error:

flat.fx(36,18) : Unexpected token '' found.
flat.fx(36,18) : Unexpected token '' found. Expected Semicolon
flat.fx(36,18) : Unexpected token '' found. Expected CloseBracket

With a pozitive number it works fine.

data.title: Add missing dispose of ConstantBuffers.
data.body: Effect can create an array of ConstantBuffer instances, but these instances were never being disposed properly.

data.title: Simple SpriteBatch Optimizations
data.body:
A couple of simple SpriteBatch optimizations:
- Pre-cached the transform parameter and effect pass lookups.
- Replaced Matrix calls with the ref/out versions to avoid the copies.
- Inlined the math for half pixel offset to avoid full Matrix transform.

I tested this on Windows DX and GL so far.  If someone with a SpriteBatch heavy game could test the GL path that would help a lot.

Any ideas hot to resolve this?

data.title: Custom Shaders and SpriteBatch on Windows 8 (RT)
Windows 8: Touch Input lag on some devices
data.body:
We got some reports from customers that our MonoGame based game Taptitude had some touch input problems on certain hardware.

We eventually got an Asus Zenbook with touchscreen and the issue reproduces on that hardware.

What happens is if you press your finger down and hold it for a split second then lift up, then the "Release" isn't handled for a very long time (multiple seconds).  This leads to a bad user interface experience and strange "stuck" touch problems.

Looking into it, I think it is very similar to this dicussion which is closed:

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/770

From debugging our problem we saw that on this particular hardware, leaving your finger down for a short amount of time builds up A LOT of touch "move" events on touch panel.  Given that only one touch event is "popped" from the event queue each time TouchPanel.GetState() is called and we only call GetState() once a frame (to see whats new since last frame) it ends up taking over 100 frames to plow through all the built up "moves" and eventually get to the "release" event.

We ended up making this change to fix the issue for our purposes:

https://github.com/FourBrosStudio/MonoGame/commit/b2407ba45a8ce8c44764e94c8f859e839bf4785d

So basically it works the same as before except it will skip over all "move" events that aren't the last one and ignore "move" if there is a "release" after it.  This is more in line with the way XNA behaves on Windows Phone.  It also means that you _will_ lose information when many moves come in a single frame so an app that wants to do precise line drawing with a finger will need to use the FreeDrag gesture instead of relying on GetState which is more like a snapshot (same as XNA on Windows Phone).

But the benefit is that it doesn't take 3+ seconds to process a finger being lifted.

Has anyone else hit this issue and what are some alternative work arounds?  We are comfortable with this change and are using it going forward but I'm not sure if there was an intentional reason to queue up move events like it was doing before.

data.title: RenderTargets crashing when trying to bind frame buffer
data.body:
been a while dudes,

i've been able to get back to trying to get out of develop branch, and get into develop3d. i'm running into problems with rendertargets still. i'm compiling for iOS.

Stack trace:
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsExtensions.CheckGLError () [0x0000c] in /Users/hexate/Projects/BeamXna/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/GraphicsExtensions.cs:620 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.ApplyRenderTargets (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTargetBinding[] renderTargets) [0x000aa] in /Users/hexate/Projects/BeamXna/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/GraphicsDevice.cs:1602 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.SetRenderTargets (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTargetBinding[] renderTargets) [0x0007e] in /Users/hexate/Projects/BeamXna/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/GraphicsDevice.cs:1530 
  at Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.GraphicsDevice.SetRenderTarget (Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Graphics.RenderTarget2D renderTarget) [0x00012] in /Users/hexate/Projects/BeamXna/MonoGame/MonoGame.Framework/Graphics/GraphicsDevice.cs:1502 

GraphicsDevice.cs line 1601

GL.BindFramebuffer(GLFramebuffer, renderTarget.glFramebuffer);
GraphicsExtensions.CheckGLError();

CheckGLError throws this:
Message "GL.GetError() returned InvalidOperation"

Any thoughts on what would cause the bind to fail? rendertargets are working in develop branch, i use them pretty extensively, and this bars me from develop3d. are there significant differences in how they work under the hood between develop and develop3d? if not i could maybe go hunting for clues.

data.title: Color Fix
data.body:
Some bug fixes and/or optimizations to Color.

The basic issue was that the constructors do clamping... so clamping in Lerp/Multiply is pointless.  Worse Color.Multiply was doing a floating point clamp instead of integer.
- Fixed Color.Lerp() to not double clamp.
- Fixed Color.Multipy() to not double clamp.
- Added Color to unit tests.

The unit test verifies that XNA and MonoGame behave the same with Lerp and Multiply.

data.title: Changed fields to remove leading underscore in templates
data.body: Updated the VS 2012 Template Game1.cs files to be consistent with the other templates and with the original XNA GS templates

data.title: RenderTarget2D captures only one frame
For Review - centralised helper classes to reduce code duplication between platforms
data.body:
See fork repo of main develop branch below

https://github.com/DDReaper/MonoGame/tree/develop.helperclasses

Putting up as a suggested path before more investment.

Aim is to create a set of single file helper classes to do platform specific operations in one place, currently there is a fair amount of code duplication across the projects for doing the same task.  

Secondary Aim, with the refactoring and relocating #if platform blocks to a helper class, more classes should be able to me moved to the core project when adopted

Thoughts?  Is this worth investment?

*Note
Only one Helper class added at present as a working example
No code changes to files made as yet, only comments added for method changes to use new helper class
